Detailed Description

Author:
Michael Betancourt, Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Abstract class defining the nested sampling algorithm.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

chainNest::chainNest ( TRandom3 *  random  ) 

Constructor

Parameters:
random Pointer to external random number generator

Member Function Documentation

void chainNest::computeMeanExpectations (  )  [virtual]

Compute Monte Carlo posterior expectations assuming the means of the shrinkage distributions. Note that this virtual implementation computes the posterior expectation of only the first component of the feature space

See also:
computeSampledExpectations()

void chainNest::computeSampledExpectations ( int  nSamples  )  [virtual]

Compute Monte Carlo posterior expectations, marginalizing over the shrinkage distributions. Note that this virtual implementation computes the posterior expectation of only the first component of the feature space.

See also:
computeMeanExpectations()
Parameters:
nSamples Number of Monte Carlo samples for each shrinkage distribution

void chainNest::nestedSample (  ) 

Sample from the posterior distribution with nested sampling See Betancourt, M. J., arXiv:1005.0157 (http://arxiv.org/abs/1005.0157)

Examples:
main.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

double* chainNest::mGradLogL [protected]

Gradient of the log likelihood constraint surface, necessary to be memory allocated/freed in a derived implementation.

double* chainNest::mNormal [protected]

Normal to the current constraint, necessary to be memory allocated/freed in a derived implementation.
